TopicTitle: Physics breaking, twice observed, says article

Articles.Content:
http://www.scientificamerican.com/article/2-accelerators-find-particles-that-may-break-known-laws-of-physics1/?WT.mc_id=SA_SPC_20150910

Im not putting out their conclusion, just linking the article. The articles states that two collidors are observing an excess of leptons over other expected types of particle.

And that's definitely physics breaking rather than a flaw in our models. You've been getting a bit click-batey PB666. (And so is the source)

Edited September 10, 2015 by NFUN

physics breaking!!! THE UNIVERSE IS TEARING ITSELF APART! THE APOCALYPSE! NO WHERE TO HIDE! WE ARE ALL DOOOOOOMED! DOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOMED!

ok now for serious this is a flaw in our models and the zoo particle model isnt even complete, not to talk about having multiple ways of calculating the predicted results of the experiment some models may show just that kind of spike. also even though it has happened twice this is not really significant in any way, and the deviation from the model is quite small too so in the end-nothing to be super excited about

Jeb, WHAT DID YOU DO?!
